p: The enzymes involved in the last three steps of RA biosynthesis, RAS and the 3-and 3â€™-hydroxylases, have been characterized in cellular and subcellular preparations of suspension cells of C. blumei [ 77, 78]. The high sequence similarity between hydroxycinnamoyl transferases and the meta-hydroxylases suggests they are closely related, but expression studies in heterologous systems have shown that the enzymes from C. blumei are specific for substrates involved in RA biosynthesis [ 79, 80].
